abstracts.cdata!:
The overall aim of the Technical
            Assistance Project is to support the government's
            enterprise and financial sector reform program which will be
            supported by the Enterprise and Financial Sector Adjustment
            Loan currently under preparation. Specifically, the
            objectives of the project are: 1) to assist the government
            to complete the privatization of former socially-owned
            enterprises (FSOEs); 2) to help in the restructuring and
            privatization of public enterprises (PEs) through studies
            and advisory services; and 3) to support the rehabilitation
            and privatization of the banking system. The components of
            the project are the following: 1) privatization of FSOEs,
            including the recruitment of consultants/privatization
            advisors; 2) restructuring and privatization of PEs, which
            will consist of: (a) the hiring a financial analyst and an
            audit expert to assist the Office for the Restructuring and
            Economics of State-owned Enterprises (ORESE); (b) a Kutina
            Fertilizer Company, strategic planning and restructuring
            study; (b) an Industrija Nafte (petrochemical company)
            study; (c) complementary studies in the power sector; (d) a
            tariff study for the Croatian Post and Telecommunications;
            and (e) a spectrum management study; and 3) rehabilitation
            and privatization of the banking system comprising: (a) a
            legal advisor for the Bank Rehabilitation Agency (BRA); (b)
            accounting and miscellaneous services for the BRA; (c) a
            senior advisor for rehabilitation; and (d) financial
            advisory services.
